episodeTitle: Slashes Dancing on the Roof! Finale - Zoro vs. Ryuma
episodeTitleJapanese: 屋根に舞う斬撃！！決着ゾロVSリューマ
episodeTitleRomanized: Yane ni Mau Zangeki!! Kecchaku Zoro tai Ryūma
description: Zoro duels the zombie samurai Ryuma in an intense battle that destroys Hogback's laboratory and continues on the castle roof. After an epic sword fight, Zoro defeats Ryuma using his new fire-based technique, earning the legendary black blade Shusui and restoring Brook's shadow.

events.title: Zoro vs Ryuma Duel Intensifies
events.description: Zoro and Ryuma continue their evenly matched sword duel in Hogback's laboratory. Both swordsmen display incredible skill, matching each other's attacks blow for blow with neither gaining advantage.
events.significance: This establishes Ryuma as one of Zoro's most formidable opponents, testing his three-sword style against a legendary samurai's technique.

quotes.text: So you think you can take my black blade Shusui away from me, do you?
quotes.speaker: Ryuma
quotes.context: Ryuma challenges Zoro's determination to claim the legendary sword

quotes.text: Oh, I'm taking it. I'm about to cut you down and wrench it from your cold, dead, body.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro's confident response to Ryuma's challenge

events.title: Ryuma's Fencing Techniques Revealed
events.description: Ryuma demonstrates several fencing-style sword techniques including Aubade Coup Droit, Prelude: Au Fer, Gavotte Bond en Avant, and Polka Remise, showcasing his unique blend of Eastern and Western swordsmanship.
events.significance: These techniques reveal Ryuma's diverse fighting style and establish him as a master swordsman who transcends traditional boundaries.

events.title: Laboratory Destruction Forces Roof Battle
events.description: The fierce exchanges between Zoro and Ryuma completely destroy Hogback's laboratory, forcing both combatants to escape to the castle roof to continue their duel.
events.significance: The destruction demonstrates the intensity of their battle and sets up the iconic rooftop confrontation.

events.title: Rooftop Duel Commences
events.description: Zoro and Ryuma continue their epic sword fight on the mansion roof under the moonlight, with the battle reaching new heights of intensity as both warriors push their skills to the limit.
events.significance: This iconic setting creates one of the most memorable sword duels in the Thriller Bark arc.

quotes.text: It looks to me that you already have three swords.
quotes.speaker: Ryuma

quotes.text: True. But... one's broken and I've gotten used to carrying three, so it feels weird not to. See, I use three-sword style.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro explains his commitment to three-sword style despite Yubashiri being broken

events.title: Zoro Debuts Hiryu: Kaen
events.description: Zoro unleashes his new one-sword style technique, Hiryu: Kaen (Flying Dragon Blaze), jumping high into the air and delivering a devastating slash that engulfs Ryuma in blue flames.
events.significance: This marks the debut of one of Zoro's most powerful and iconic techniques, which becomes crucial in future battles. The technique honors Ryuma's legendary dragon-slaying feat from Oda's earlier work 'Monsters'.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Ryuma
events.description: After Zoro's Hiryu: Kaen technique, Ryuma staggers and acknowledges his defeat. The legendary samurai recognizes Zoro as the superior swordsman and accepts his loss with honor.
events.significance: This victory proves Zoro's growth as a swordsman and earns him the respect of a legendary warrior, setting up the acquisition of Shusui.

quotes.text: I wish I could have met you before you died.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Zoro acknowledges Ryuma's skill and expresses regret that he couldn't face him in life

events.title: Shusui Passed to Zoro
events.description: Ryuma sheathes Shusui and throws the legendary black blade to Zoro, entrusting the national treasure of Wano Country to him. This is one of the 21 Great Grade swords and becomes Zoro's replacement for his broken Yubashiri.
events.significance: Zoro acquires one of the most legendary swords in the One Piece world, a black blade that will serve him until the Wano Arc. This moment foreshadows Zoro's deep connection to Wano Country and the Shimotsuki clan.

events.title: Ryuma's Zombie Body Disintegrates
events.description: After passing Shusui to Zoro, Ryuma's zombie body collapses in flames and disintegrates, finally putting the legendary samurai's corpse to rest.
events.significance: This grants peace to Ryuma's desecrated remains and allows Brook's shadow to return to its rightful owner.

events.title: Brook's Shadow Returns
events.description: With Ryuma's defeat, Brook's shadow is finally freed and returns to its rightful owner after being stolen by Gecko Moria. Brook celebrates emotionally, realizing he can now walk in daylight again after years of being unable to.
events.significance: This resolves one of Brook's major conflicts and removes a critical weakness, allowing him to function normally and setting up his potential to join the Straw Hat crew.

events.title: Franky Guards Brook
events.description: Throughout the episode, Franky is shown guarding the injured Brook, demonstrating the growing bonds between Brook and the Straw Hat Pirates.
events.significance: This protective behavior foreshadows Brook's eventual acceptance as a Straw Hat crew member.

themes.description: The duel between Zoro and Ryuma exemplifies mutual respect between warriors. Despite being enemies, both acknowledge each other's skill, and Ryuma willingly passes his sword to Zoro upon defeat.
themes.symbolism: The passing of Shusui represents the transfer of a warrior's legacy and the recognition of a worthy successor.
culturalReferences: The concept of a worthy opponent in martial arts philosophy

themes.description: Ryuma's legendary blade finds a new master, connecting past and future generations of swordsmen. This theme explores how the will and strength of great warriors lives on through those who inherit their possessions.
themes.symbolism: Shusui serves as a physical manifestation of Ryuma's legacy passing to Zoro, bridging the present with Wano's legendary past.
culturalReferences: The legendary status of meito (famous swords) in Japanese culture

themes.description: Zoro's victory over Ryuma represents his continuous growth as a swordsman, developing new techniques and pushing his limits against formidable opponents.
themes.symbolism: The fire of Hiryu: Kaen symbolizes Zoro's burning determination and the forge through which his skills are refined.

themes.description: Brook regaining his shadow represents liberation from years of confinement to darkness, restoring his ability to live freely.
themes.symbolism: The shadow's return symbolizes the restoration of one's complete self and the recovery of lost freedom.

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro demonstrates significant growth in his swordsmanship by developing the Hiryu: Kaen technique and earning the legendary blade Shusui through honorable combat. His respect for Ryuma shows his maturity as a warrior.

Debuts his new fire-based technique Hiryu: Kaen
Shows respect to Ryuma as a fellow swordsman

characterSpotlights.development: Ryuma displays the qualities that made him a legend - incredible skill, honor in battle, and the grace to acknowledge defeat. Though a zombie, his warrior spirit remains intact.

Passes Shusui to Zoro before his final rest

characterSpotlights.development: Brook's emotional reaction to regaining his shadow shows the depth of his suffering and joy at restoration. This moment brings him closer to joining the Straw Hats.

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Hiryu: Kaen produces blue flames when hitting Ryuma, while the manga doesn't specify a color for the flames.
The anime extends the battle sequences between Zoro and Ryuma with additional exchanges not present in the manga to fill the episode runtime.
The Zoro eyecatcher segment omits his theme audio while Nami's includes hers, a production anomaly unique to this episode.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapters 466 (pages 16-19) and 467 (pages 2-19) from the manga.
Hiryu: Kaen features a dragon motif that resembles the dragon Ryuma slayed in Eiichiro Oda's earlier one-shot manga 'Monsters', which is set in the same world as One Piece.

sources.title: Analyzing the nature of Zoro's Hiryu Kaen - One Piece

trivia.fact: Ryuma is voiced by the same actor as Brook (Chō in Japanese, Ian Sinclair in English) because the zombie possesses Brook's shadow, which affects the voice.
Shusui is one of the 21 Great Grade swords (大業物 Ō Wazamono) and a black blade, making it one of the rarest and most powerful swords in the One Piece world.
The episode's TV rating in Japan was 7.8%, ranking 6th for that week.
Zoro would later use Hiryu: Kaen against Kaido in Episode 1017 during the Wano Arc, showing the technique's continued relevance.
